title: Cannot migrate my contracts
body:
## Issue

I have now tried two machines and cannot migrate my contracts after they have successfully compiled. I get no output at all acutally.


## Steps to Reproduce

truffle migrate

## Expected Behavior

A migration

## Actual Results

nothing

## Environment
Windows 10
VS Code
Truffle v5.1.25 (core: 5.1.25)
Solidity - 0.6.2 (solc-js)
Node v12.16.3
Web3.js v1.2.1

Could you describe the problem in more detail?  Do you have any error messages you could show us, or more detailed reproduction steps, such as a reproduction project we could try this with?  Thank you!

It terminates silently there is no error messages it just displays that it compiled successfully and then gives me back to the prompt.

Jason Romero
Application Developer

I already responded to this same message. It fails silently and just returns to prompt. There is no error message or I wouldnâ€™t be here. I am on Windows 10 using VS code. Oh, also I have never been able to unbox a truffle project, which blows. I am now moving to Ubuntu and Mac and leaving this POS windows for the kiddies. I know there are a ton of people with these same issues in some of my communities and would like to see this get resolved.

Jason

That is very weird, what happens if you use `truffle develop`? You can run `truffle develop` and the when the prompt appears, you run `migrate`.
@codenamejason Is your project here on GitHub? I would like to see if I can duplicate your error on my machine.
I now have it working on main branch. I am still not sure of why the behavior I got happened. I think it has something to do with either my truffle-config.js or deploy scripts.
Ok thanks, I'll try and duplicate your error and get back to you!
Hey sorry @codenamejason, I realized that I might have missed the message where you said that you resolved this. Just to verify, you were able to solve this issue? Let me know!
Hi @codenamejason sounds like this is resolved! I'm closing this for issue maintenance but please open a new issue if something comes up.
